Fund Data
Fund Overview
SBI Large Cap Fund aims to provide investors with opportunities for long-term growth in capital through an active management of investments in a diversified basket of large cap equity
The fund invests a minimum of 80% in large cap stocks*. Generally, Large cap stocks are well established companies having good brand equity and are possibly market leaders in their industries
SBI Large Cap Fund has the flexibility to invest up to 20% in equities other than large caps or debt and/or money market instruments
The fund follows a blend of growth and value style of investing with a combination of top down and bottom-up investment strategy for stock selection across sectors
*Large Cap Stocks are – 1st -100th company in terms of full market capitalization.
Mr. Saurabh Pant -
Saurabh Pant has over 16 years experience in capital markets. He joined SBI Funds Management Limited as a research analyst and currently manages equity funds. Saurabh is a Commerce graduate and holds a Master'sDegree in Business Economics from the University of Delhi.

*Investors should consult their financial advisors if in doubt whether the product is suitable for them.

Notes:
Different plans shall have different expense structure. In case of return calculated the IDCW option, it is assumed that dividend declared under the schemes have been reinvested at the prevailing NAV
Past performance may or may not be sustained in future and same may not necessarily provide the basis for comparison with other investment
Load is not considered for computation of returns
Period for which scheme’s performance has been provided is computed basis last day of the month-end preceding the date of advertisement. In case, the start/end date of the concerned period is a non-business day, the NAV of the previous date is considered for computation of returns
The data of the last working day has been considered for the calculation of performance
Wherever TRI data since inception for benchmarks is not available, benchmark performance is calculated using composite of CAGR and TRI values of the benchmark
The performance of the schemes is benchmarked to the Total Return variant of the Index
To view other open ended funds managed by the fund manager go to the Fund Manager section

FAQ Section
How to Invest in SBI Large Cap Fund (Formerly known as SBI Bluechip Fund)?
> Log in to the website.
> Choose between Lumpsum or Systematic Investment Plan (SIP).
> Choose your bank and preferred payment method.
> An OTP will be sent to your registered email ID and mobile number.
> Your transaction will be processed after OTP verification.
What is the current NAV of SBI Large Cap Fund (Formerly known as SBI Bluechip Fund)?
Latest closing NAV as on 14 Nov, 2025 for SBI Large Cap Fund (Formerly known as SBI Bluechip Fund) - Regular Plan - Growth is Rs. 94.9866
What is the AUM of SBI Large Cap Fund (Formerly known as SBI Bluechip Fund)?
AUM of SBI Large Cap Fund (Formerly known as SBI Bluechip Fund) is 54705.44 Cr.
What is the Riskometer level of SBI Large Cap Fund (Formerly known as SBI Bluechip Fund)?
SBI Large Cap Fund (Formerly known as SBI Bluechip Fund) is rated as a VERY HIGH. Benchmark Riskometer for this fund is S&P BSE 100 Index.
What are the top holdings of SBI Large Cap Fund (Formerly known as SBI Bluechip Fund)?
Top Holdings for the fund as per percentage of amount invested is as follows:
> RELIANCE INDUSTRIES LTD. : 7.88 %
> HDFC BANK LTD. : 7.35 %
> ICICI BANK LTD. : 7.13 %
> LARSEN & TOUBRO LTD. : 5.45 %
> INFOSYS LTD. : 3.96 %
> EICHER MOTORS LTD. : 3.95 %
Is there any lock-in period for SBI Large Cap Fund (Formerly known as SBI Bluechip Fund)?
No lock-in period is applicable for this fund.
What is the expense ratio of SBI Large Cap Fund (Formerly known as SBI Bluechip Fund)?
Expense ratio for Regular scheme is 1.48% as on 31 Oct 2025 and Expense Ratio for Direct Scheme is 0.81% as on 31 Oct 2025
How can I redeem my investments in SBI Large Cap Fund (Formerly known as SBI Bluechip Fund)?
> Login to your account.
> In the Dashboard, go to the Portfolio Snapshot section and click on Transact > Redeem.
> Enter the Amount/Units you wish to redeem.
> An OTP will be sent to your registered email ID/mobile number.
> After OTP verification, your redemption will be processed in 3 business working days.
What are the top sectors SBI Large Cap Fund (Formerly known as SBI Bluechip Fund) has invested in?
Sector Allocations for as per percentage of amount invested is as follows:
> FINANCIAL SERVICES : 30.57 %
> OIL, GAS & CONSUMABLE FUELS : 8.85 %
> AUTOMOBILE AND AUTO COMPONENTS : 8.54 %
> FAST MOVING CONSUMER GOODS : 6.7 %
> HEALTHCARE : 5.95 %
> INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY : 5.65 %
Who manages the SBI Large Cap Fund (Formerly known as SBI Bluechip Fund)?
The Fund manager for this fund is:
> Mr. Saurabh Pant since April 2024
What is the minimum investment in SBI Large Cap Fund (Formerly known as SBI Bluechip Fund)?
Minimum Lumpsum Amount applicable for this fund is Rs. 5000 in multiples of 1.
Minimum Additional Lumpsum Amount applicable for this fund is Rs. 1000 in multiples of 1.
Minimum SIP Amount applicable for fund is Rs. 500
